children.description: Based on the user's request for a list of horror and thriller movies with their IMDb ratings and torrent links, I can see that they are looking for a comprehensive selection of movies for their movie night. The current API call to the "list_movies" function with the argument "genre: horror,thriller" is made to retrieve the desired movies specifically in the horror and thriller genres. By calling this API with the specified genre, I will be able to fetch a list of horror and thriller movies along with their IMDb ratings and torrent links, which will meet the user's requirements for their movie night.

children.observation: {"error": "Unsubscribed error...", "response": "{'message': 'You are not subscribed to this API.'}"}

children.description: I'm sorry, but it seems that I am currently unable to access the movie database to retrieve the list of horror and thriller movies with their IMDb ratings. Please try again later.

Based on the previous action, it seems that there was an error with the API subscription. To avoid the same error, I will try a different approach. Instead of using the "genre_for_list_movies" function, I will use the "query_term_for_list_movies" function to search for horror and thriller movies. This way, I can obtain a list of movies with their IMDb ratings.

children.description: l previous attempts to retrieve the list of horror and thriller movies with IMDb ratings and torrent links failed due to the API subscription issue, I need to come up with a different approach. function.name: with_rt_ratings_for_list_movies
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "list_movies", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Returns the list with the Rotten Tomatoes rating included"

function.name: order_by_for_list_movies
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "list_movies", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Orders the results by either Ascending or Descending order"

function.name: sort_by_for_list_movies
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "list_movies", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Sorts the results by choosen value"

function.name: genre_for_list_movies
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "list_movies", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Used to filter by a given genre (See http://www.imdb.com/genre/ for full list)"

function.name: query_term_for_list_movies
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "list_movies", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Used for movie search, matching on: Movie Title/IMDb Code, Actor Name/IMDb Code, Director Name/IMDb Code"

function.name: minimum_rating_for_list_movies
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "list_movies", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Used to filter movie by a given minimum IMDb rating"

function.name: quality_for_list_movies
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "list_movies", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Used to filter by a given quality"

function.name: page_for_list_movies
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "list_movies", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Used to see the next page of movies, eg limit=15 and page=2 will show you movies 15-30"

function.name: limit_for_list_movies
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "list_movies", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "The limit of results per page that has been set"

function.name: list_movies_for_list_movies
function.description: This is the subfunction for tool "list_movies", you can use this tool.The description of this function is: "Used to list and search through out all the available movies. Can sort, filter, search and order the results"

function.name: Finish
function.description: If you believe that you have obtained a result that can answer the task, please call this function to provide the final answer. Alternatively, if you recognize that you are unable to proceed with the task in the current state, call this function to restart. Remember: you must ALWAYS call this function at the end of your attempt, and the only part that will be shown to the user is the final answer, so it should contain sufficient information.

final_answer.description: The final answer you want to give the user. You should have this field if "return_type"=="give_answer"

train_messages.content:
You are AutoGPT, you can use many tools(functions) to do the following task.
First I will give you the task description, and your task start.
At each step, you need to give your thought to analyze the status now and what to do next, with a function call to actually excute your step.
After the call, you will get the call result, and you are now in a new state.
Then you will analyze your status now, then decide what to do next...
After many (Thought-call) pairs, you finally perform the task, then you can give your finial answer.
Remember: 
1.the state change is irreversible, you can't go back to one of the former state, if you want to restart the task, say "I give up and restart".
2.All the thought is short, at most in 5 sentence.
3.You can do more then one trys, so if your plan is to continusly try some conditions, you can do one of the conditions per try.
Let's Begin!
Task description: You should use functions to help handle the real time user querys. Remember:
1.ALWAYS call "Finish" function at the end of the task. And the final answer should contain enough information to show to the user,If you can't handle the task, or you find that function calls always fail(the function is not valid now), use function Finish->give_up_and_restart.
2.Do not use origin tool names, use only subfunctions' names.
You have access of the following tools:
1.list_movies: An API used to list and search through out all the available movies. Can sort, filter, search and order the results

I am planning a movie night with my friends and we want to watch movies in the genre of horror and thriller. Can you give me a list of horror and thriller movies with their IMDb ratings? Additionally, provide the torrent links for each movie.
Begin!

This is not the first time you try this task, all previous trails failed.
Before you generate my thought for this state, I will first show you your previous actions for this state, and then you must generate actions that is different from all of them. Here are some previous actions candidates:
[
  {
    "name": "genre_for_list_movies",
    "arguments": "{\n  \"genre\": \"horror,thriller\"\n}",
    "function_output": "{\"error\": \"Unsubscribed error...\", \"response\": \"{'message': 'You are not subscribed to this API.'}\"}",
    "mento-carlo-action-value": 0.0
  }
]

Remember you are now in the intermediate state of a trail, you will first analyze the now state and previous action candidates, then make actions that is different from all the previous.

Instead of using the "genre_for_list_movies" function, I will use the "query_term_for_list_movies" function to search for horror and thriller movies. This way, I can obtain a list of movies with their IMDb ratings.
